content.body: Huh. The new comment end space stuff has the ability to produce a lot of errors.
Also, switching the state is strictly unnecessary.
Sweet, PHP spec up to space
ezyang: did you see the next checkin? http://html5.org/tools/web-apps-tracker?from=3195&to=3196
has just been using git blame and going through stuff more recent than when it was last updated
hsivonen, you remember our ActiveX control chat a while ago? Perhaps something can be slammed together using http://wiki.videolan.org/ActiveX and a JS wrapper
I'm currently trying to evaluate how well this works with a clean WinXP image
if things happen to take twenty mouse-clicks, three registry hacks and five reboots things *may* not be user-friendly enough
hsivonen, okay, it seems IE only allows the installation of signed controls by now (wise move) - that's something VLC can't provide due to associated costs

hsivonen, but even when lowering security settings in IE (shoot me now, thanks) http://people.xiph.org/~maikmerten/demos/bigbuckbunny-activex.html won't work for me (VLC will install, but I just see solid black where the player should be). This could be some problem with VirtualBox.
w00t
has US iTunes account, so can finally download Truth in 24
zcorpan_: Aha
WWDC 2003 Keynote Coverage -- Live
Macworld - ‎1 hour ago‎
FAIL
wonders why <legend> and <caption> don't allow block-level children
Or rather I think it is a bug
s/block-level/flow content/ if you like
Technology Quarterly, yay!
http://james.html5.org/table_descriptions/
Work in progress, please don't email public-html about it yet
Feedback here or by email welcome (but I won't deal with it until after I sleep)
testcases for different suggestions for marking up table descriptions
ideas taken from the wiki page although I ignored <description> or whatever it's called since that has unrealistic requirements
(several paragraphs of detailed descriptions)
and I ignored <table><details> because that is just silly
Although I can add that if people want to see it
Also I haven't validated the pages or anything so they are probably full of basic errors
Have I already mentioned that <legend> is a rather irritating element to use with <details> and <figure>? It really makes all the examples much worse
Right that is enough soloquiy for now. Otherwise I will have gsnedders writing an essay on me
Which would just be embarassing, frankly
wonders what to say…
jgraham: When did I ever write an essay on anyone!?
gsnedders: e.g. for your english ah
That wasn't on anyone.
.me really is going now
It was on several works of fictio!
*fiction
All written by the same someone
